bestBHT.bht: Beware of those who love titles and honor, seeking the chief places and highest seats. They desire to be saluted with grandiose titles like Rabbi and Master. Let us not fall into the trap of seeking earthly recognition and honor, but instead humbly serve and follow the true teachings of the Lord, avoiding the arrogance and pride that come with seeking worldly status and preeminence.

Marvin Vincent: Chief rooms. Rev., correctly, chief places. See on Mark 12:39.
John Gill: His flesh must not appear under his garments, as the light linen garments, and the like, they make in Egypt; nor must his garments be drawn upon the ground, as the garments of proud men, but must reach to his heel, and his glove must reach the top of his fingers."
They loved to be saluted with the titles of Rabbi, Master, and the like.
The highest seats in the synagogues; which were next to the place where the book of the law was read and expounded, and where they might be seen by the people.

bhtAttempts.bht: Beware of those who seek the chief places and desire the highest seats, for they love titles and honor. Their garments are long and veiled, hiding their flesh and reaching to their heels, displaying their humility. They love to be saluted with grandiose titles like Rabbi and Master. They desire to be seen in the synagogues, seated in positions close to where the law is read and expounded, where they can be seen by all. Let us not fall into the trap of seeking earthly recognition and honor, but instead let us humbly serve and follow the true teachings of the Lord.

Beware of those who seek the chief places and desire the highest seats, for they love titles and honor. They loved to be saluted with grandiose titles like Rabbi and Master. Let us not fall into the trap of seeking earthly recognition and honor, but instead let us humbly serve and follow the true teachings of the Lord.

Beware of those who love titles and honor, seeking the chief places and highest seats. They desire to be saluted with grandiose titles like Rabbi and Master. Let us not fall into the trap of seeking earthly recognition and honor, but instead humbly serve and follow the true teachings of the Lord, avoiding the arrogance and pride that come with seeking worldly status and preeminence.

Beware of those who seek the chief places and desire the highest seats. They love titles and honor, desiring to be saluted with grandiose titles like Rabbi and Master. Let us not fall into the trap of seeking earthly recognition and honor, but instead humbly serve and follow the true teachings of the Lord. May we avoid the arrogance and pride that come with seeking worldly status and preeminence, and instead clothe ourselves with humility.

Beware of those who seek the chief places and desire the highest seats, for they love titles and honor. They loved to be saluted with grandiose titles like Rabbi and Master. Let us not fall into the trap of seeking earthly recognition and honor, but instead humbly serve and follow the true teachings of the Lord. May we avoid the arrogance and pride that come with seeking worldly status and preeminence, and instead prioritize humility in our lives.
